content:
What is the formula to calculate the average number of protesters per hour during the protest in Honolulu, HI based on the data collected every 10 minutes?
[formula] (total number of protesters) / ((end time - start time) / 60 / 60)

To calculate the average number of protesters per hour during the protest in Honolulu, HI, based on data collected every 10 minutes, you can use the following formula:

\[
\text{Average protesters per hour} = \frac{\text{Total number of protesters}}{\left(\frac{\text{End time} - \text{Start time}}{60}\right)}
\]

Here's a breakdown of the formula:

1. **Total number of protesters**: Sum up the number of protesters recorded at each 10-minute interval throughout the protest duration.

2. **End time - Start time**: Calculate the total duration of the protest in minutes by subtracting the start time from the end time.

3. **Divide by 60**: Convert the duration from minutes to hours by dividing by 60.

By applying this formula, you can determine the average number of protesters present per hour during the protest.
